title: Mighty Morphin Power Rangers: Once & Always
synopsis: In 2022, Billy Cranston calls in the Mighty Morphin' Power Rangers to fight a robotic version of Rita Repulsa and her Putties.
However, Robo-Rita vaporizes Trini Kwan and flees to plan her revenge.
Billy and Zack Taylor are forced to tell Trini's now-orphaned daughter Minh about her fate.
One year later, Zack has become the guardian of Minh.
They go to meet the other Rangers at Trini's grave to mark the anniversary of her death but come upon an ambush by Robo-Rita, Robo-Snizzard, and Robo-Minotaur.
Robo-Snizzard captures Jason Lee Scott, Tommy Oliver, and Kimberly Hart and imprisons them in a machine.
Minh reacts badly when Zack and Billy don't want her involved in the recovery mission and blames Billy for Trini's death.
A flashback revealed that Billy built a new Command Center secretly under his company Cranston Tech.
He works with Alpha 8 to attempt to revive his former mentor Zordon by collecting particles from the Z-Wave.
However, they end up with the evil purged from Rita Repulsa's original body which possesses Alpha 8 and reshapes it into a new body called Robo-Rita.
Alpha 9 initiates the Bandora Protocol, alerting all Ranger teams throughout the universe, as Putties attack all of Earth.
Former Rangers Kat Hillard and Rocky DeSantos teleport to the Command Center, being given proxy Power Coins so they can again morph.
As they battle, Alpha overhears Minotaur tout his ability to track morphed Rangers and alerts Rangers worldwide to power down.
Meanwhile, Minh unsuccessfully attempts to use Trini's Power Morpher to battle Putties at the juice bar and is overwhelmed until Zack and Rocky teleport in.
Upon their return to the Command Center, Zack has a heart-to-heart talk with Minh about what it means to be a Power Ranger.
At a junkyard, Billy, Rocky, and Kat morph to lure out Robo-Snizzard and Robo-Minotaur, then trap them on a giant electromagnet.
Using Stealth Tech Projectors, the Rangers infiltrate Rita's Moon Palace and discover that several more Rangers have been captured and frozen in Robo-Rita's machine.
Minh takes one of the Stealth Tech Projectors to sneak past Alpha and commandeers Billy's RADBUG.
However, she is captured at the junkyard by Robo-Rita.
Billy deduces that Robo-Rita is constructing a time portal using the power of the captured Rangers to contact her past self, hoping to kill the Power Rangers before Zordon can recruit them.
Robo-Rita arrives with Robo-Snizzard, Robo-Minotaur, and a captured Minh in tow.
Robo-Rita attempts to kill Billy, but Minh jumps in front of the blast.
The other Rangers fear her dead, but this good deed bonds the morpher to Minh.
Kat, Rocky, and Zack battle and destroy Robo-Minotaur, while Billy and Minh form the Megazord to battle an enlarged Robo-Snizzard.
After Robo-Snizzard is destroyed, the Rangers return to the Moon Palace where Minh and Zack finally destroy Robo-Rita once and for all.
Back on Earth, former Rangers Adam Park and Aisha Campbell prepare to take the newly freed Rangers (including Jason, Kimberly, and Tommy) to the planet Aquitar to be fully healed.
Billy, Zack, and Minh celebrate their victory at the Juice Bar.
After Billy notes that it still might be possible to bring back Zordon one day, he and Zack tell Minh about their past adventures.

title: Spoiler Alert (film)
synopsis: In 2001, Michael Ausiello, a writer for TV Guide, is brought to a gay nightclub by his best friend in Manhattan.
There, he meets photographer Kit Cowan, and the two instantly connect.
As they begin dating, Michael struggles with his insecurities of not being attractive enough for Kit, previously being overweight.
Kit reveals that he had an affair.
They both admit their fears of being in a long-term relationship since neither of them had been in one before, but they decide to continue dating.
During their first Christmas together, Kit gives Michael his own closet space at his apartment.
One year later, Kit gets an appendectomy.
His parents, Bob and Marilyn, come to Manhattan, and Kit has yet to come out to them.
Marilyn grows suspicious of Michael.
After she incessantly interrogates him, Kit comes out to his parents and reveals that Michael is his boyfriend.
While initially upset that Kit could not admit this to her, Marilyn is accepting and welcomes Michael.
Michael and Kit continue their relationship and move into a townhouse together.
During their second Christmas, Kit joins Michael in lying under the Christmas tree with him as Michael explains it was a childhood fantasy of his to do it every year with his partner.
In 2013, Michael and Kit develop complications in their relationship as their sex life deteriorates.
Michael spends too much time with his company TVLine and becomes an alcoholic.
He also suspects Kit is having an affair with his coworker, Sebastian.
Their therapist believes they now resent each other, but they still love each other enough to not want to end it.
He suggests that they separate to reassess their feelings.
Kit moves out, but the two remain in their relationship.
During their thirteenth Christmas, Kit begins showing signs of ill health.
In 2014, Kit is diagnosed with a rare form of stage-4 neuroendocrine cancer.
Michael, still traumatized by his mother's death from cancer, moves Kit back in and the two reconcile.
Michael supports Kit as he undergoes treatment.
Kit's health worsens and is given six weeks left to live.
Michael apologizes to Kit for not letting him know how beautiful he was due to his fears of being left for a more attractive man.
Kit apologizes to Michael for having an affair with Sebastian.
Kit proposes to Michael and they marry the next day.
The two spend their last Christmas together, with Michael fantasizing himself and Kit growing old and lying under the Christmas tree together.
In 2015, Kit is taken to the hospital.
As Kit nears death, Michael allows Sebastian to say goodbye to him.
As Kit is dying, Michael fantasizes interviewing Kit as a departing actor whose character is being killed off a television show.
Kit expresses gratitude for his "time on the show" and is looking forward to the future.
Michael asks Kit what he should do, and Kit assures him that he will figure it out.
Back in reality, Michael thanks Kit for giving him a family.
After Kit's death, Michael continues to be a part of Bob and Marilyn's lives.
Michael prepares to leave New York for Los Angeles.
As he's nervous to start his new journey, he remembers how brave he was to begin his adventure with Kit.

title: Borderline (2022 film)
synopsis: Elliot Rossi, a twenty-four-year-old art graduate packed with raw talent and promise, has found himself battling on the gritty streets of overcrowded London, crushed under economic pressure and struggling to meet ends.

In his desperation, Elliot makes a regrettable decision that destabilizes his life - he becomes part of the Savage Serpents, a notorious criminal organization that casts its menacing shadow over the city’s underworld.
The organization assigns Elliot the tasks of smuggling high-grade, illicit drugs from the grimy underbelly of Marseille, France into England.
He skillfully uses deceptions such as fake IDs and hidden compartments, to sidestep the ever-vigilant eyes of law enforcement.
Elliot's life darkens further when he is arrested during a high-profile, nighttime smuggling operation at Dover port.
The officers from the Metropolitan Police Department, renowned for their unyielding pursuit of justice, catch him red-handed.
Leading Elliot's investigation is Detective Sophia Harper, a fiercely tenacious officer with an impeccable record.
She interrogates him within the cold walls of Hackney Police Station, her unwavering gaze focused on extracting the truth.
In Elliot, Sophia finds a man drowning in desperation rather than a remorseless criminal.
She senses his longing for a chance to break free from the dangerous, unpredictable life he's trapped in.
Sophia, seizing the opportunity, offers Elliot a deal that could wipe his slate clean.
She suggests a daring gambit - for him to act as an undercover informant, helping her ambitious mission to break down the veiled network of the Savage Serpents.
Squeezed into a corner and with limited options, Elliot hesitantly embraces this risky proposition.
He agrees to be an ally to Sophia, aiding her mission while concealing his new alliance from his cruel cohorts.
Bracing himself against fear, Elliot re-enters the grim criminal landscape, now double-crossing his former allies while cloaked in his undercover identity.
Sophia acts as his only support, briefing him meticulously on every scenario to ensure his cover isn't blown.
Elliot faces continuous suspicion from hardened members of Savage Serpents, escalating the constant threat of his true intentions being unmasked.
Sophia maintains a close communication link with Elliot, driven by a growing empathy towards him and concern for his life amid dangerous criminals.

As they navigate the murky waters of crime and law enforcement, an authentic bond begins to form between Sophia and Elliot, sparking an inner turbulence of professional duty versus personal attachment.
But they conscientiously honor their mission before giving in to their burgeoning emotions, each continuing to walk their perilous path without confessing their affection for each other.
Their operation comes under attack when classified information leaks into the wrong hands, resulting in a callous assassination attempt that turns their world upside down.
Close to being gunned down during an evening ambush orchestrated by the very criminals, they had aimed to incarcerate, they discover that a mole had infiltrated their trusted circles.
Scandalized and angered by the shocking betrayal, Sophia and Elliot devise a brave but dangerous plan to expose the infiltrator within the formidable Metropolitan Police Department.
They craftily plant false leads to bait the traitor, ensuring they still guard the actual operation's privacy.
Their daring strategy leads them deeper into the treacherous territory, putting them directly in the crosshairs of the intimidating kingpin, Luciano, and his merciless underlings.
Their underlying plan bears intense consequences leading to a suspense-filled faceoff.
Against all odds, Sophia and Elliot capture Luciano and reveal the infiltrator in their midst.
Their narrative takes a victorious turn when they survive the relentless onslaught, marking a monumental triumph in their harrowing journey.
Elliot, basked in the dawn of his newfound freedom, finds his criminal history wiped clean, signaling the commencement of a fresh, honest life.
Sophia's unnerving bravery and adherence to duty earn her widespread praise, solidifying her stature as one of London's most esteemed detectives.
Elliot and Sophia's relationship evolves significantly, transitioning from reluctant allies to understanding partners, and eventually towards a love restrained by their tumultuous circumstances.
Acknowledging the stark reality of their circumstances and the divergence in their life paths, they share a poignant parting in the drizzling rain against a backdrop of London's skyline.
After their emotional farewell, Sophia throws herself back into her relentless war against crime.
Simultaneously, Elliot braces himself for the challenging path towards redemption that lies ahead.
The narrative concludes on a bittersweet note, with Elliot deciding to leave London.
Sophia, left standing in the rain, serves as a silhouette of the sacrifices made in the pursuit of justice.

title: Rustic Stages
synopsis: The fading Philadelphia skyline painted a picture of a fiery orange sunset that reflected on Jane’s teary eyes as she waved goodbye to her city friends, looking back one last time.

Jane walked into the small, humbly decorated school, her brand-new uniform crisp and flashy in contrast with the modest dressing of her schoolmates, making her appearance a head-turner in the down-to-earth atmosphere of rural simplicity.
An uneasy feeling of isolation crept over Jane as she tried to find her place in this new setting.

Jane, previously an outsider in the new rural town, found herself at the center of this close-knit group, reveling in an incredible sense of belonging.

From just trying to fit in, Jane had opened the floodgates for modern thought seeping into traditional setting, leading to progress.
Jane had managed to foster a harmonious relationship between the school and the community.
Today, Jane stands as an inspirational figure within the community.

Her stirring narrative is now a part of folklore, passed down through generations, reminding everyone of the incredible transformation of a city girl who found her heart and home in rural Pennsylvania.

title: Echoes of Deception
synopsis: The aroma of burnt wood and despair hangs heavily over the village that was recently razed by the British onslaught.
The expressions on the faces of the American revolutionary soldiers are grim, their hearts heavy with the aftermath of the devastating battle.
The once lively streets are now ghostly, abandoned, echoing the profound loss inhabitants of the village have experienced.
Amid the discouragement, Bea, a female soldier renowned for her wits, stands tall.
She lights up the dimly lit cabin with her strategy, elaborately detailing plans to ensnare Captain James "Jim" Bristow - a distinguished and notorious British officer.
Bea never banks on men's underestimation of women, drawing strength from her courage instead of relying on society's misplaced assumptions.
Tonight, though, she consents to don a guise of feigned vulnerability, trusting her intelligence to keep her safe.
Using her feminine charm, she is determined to win Jim's trust.
With a well-crafted lie on her lips and a believable backstory, Bea embarks on a risky venture.
Accompanied by a seemingly besotted Jim, they set off on a river journey down the Potomac, their boat bobbing along under the pretense of a romantic escape.
However, beneath the tranquillity looms a chilling plot of entrapment.
Arriving at their supposed romantic retreat, Bea reveals her ruse.
Expertly tripping hidden alarms in the wilderness, she ensnares a stunned Jim with the help of her rebel comrades waiting in silence.
In the face of relentless questioning from Bea, Jim remains composed.
Then, amidst the hostile interrogation, Jim sees through Bea's hardened exterior and in an unexpected turn of events engages her in deep conversations about life, war, and loss.
Through this moment of weakness, Bea's past is unveiled.
Images of her childhood marred by war, the relentless determination that took her through countless trials and tribulations, and the burning resolve for her cause, all surge to the forefront.
Bea's concurrent past and present create a whirl of emotions.
She experiences a wrestling match between her staunch dedication to the American cause and the awkward understanding she seems to be developing towards her British captive.
Breaking her reverie, the watchman's birdcall shatters the silence.
It is a warning sign, a coded message signifying the imminent approach of British troops towards their hidden base.

Bea is thrust back into reality as the rebel leader, sweating and fidgety, confronts her with a morose proposal - to execute Jim immediately to avoid his plea for reinforcements when the British inevitably find them.
Bea, now engulfed by sympathy for Jim, intertwines her newfound feelings with her strategic prowess, creating a audacious plan to free him.
Every decision she makes here comes with consequences that could radically alter her standing with her fellow rebels.
Under the cover of a moonless night, Bea sabotages the lone watchtower, plunging their hideout into darkness, subsequently assisting Jim's daring escape.
Jim reaches the safety of his camp, disappearing into the fortified barriers, leaving Bea amidst the ensuing chaos, a memory imprinted in his mind.
Branded a traitor, Bea finds herself deserted by her rebel comrades.
Unyielding, she uses her solitude to strengthen her resolve, preparing herself to confront the inevitable rebel attack.
As dawn breaks, the bitterness of the prior night's treason, loss, and retribution hangs in the air.
As the sun rises, illuminating the aftermath of the prison break, it mirrors the relentless cycle of war.
Although Bea's journey ends, her tale continues to resonate through Jim.
Reflecting on Bea's stubborn resilience and sacrifice, Jim finds his perception towards his enemies shifting.
Bea’s legend sparks a change in perception in Jim.
He is compelled to reevaluate his stance on the revolutionary war, her selfless act disrupting his lifelong beliefs.
No longer is the enemy faceless for him.
The image of Bea, the rebel turncoat who risked everything for him, humanizes the colonists he’s been trained to despise.
As Bea’s actions leave a lasting impact on Jim, he contemplates the human cost of war, striving for peace in a world torn apart.

The story revolves around Bea, a female American revolutionary soldier, and her intricate plan to capture Captain James "Jim" Bristow, a British officer. The narrative unfolds with Bea's strategy to use her charm and wit to gain Jim's trust, leading to his capture. However, as the story progresses, Bea and Jim engage in deep conversations, revealing their pasts and creating an unexpected bond between them. This connection complicates Bea's mission and leads to a series of events where she must choose between her loyalty to the American cause and her newfound understanding of the enemy.

### Summary of Segments and Character Development
- **Introduction**: The story begins by setting a grim scene of a village devastated by the British, introducing the main characters and their emotional states.
- **Bea's Plan**: Bea devises a plan to capture Jim, showcasing her intelligence and determination. This segment highlights her strength and strategic thinking.

title: The Unbearable Weight of Massive Talent
synopsis: Hollywood actor Nicolas "Nick" Cage is struggling with his career after being passed over for several major film roles and is constantly pestered and tormented by "Nicky", who appears to him as his younger (and more successful) self.
His relationship with his ex-wife Olivia and daughter Addy is also marred by years of emotional neglect.
Losing a key film role and following an embarrassing event at Addy's birthday party, Nick plans to retire from acting.
He decides to accept a vague offer of $1 million from his agent Richard Fink that involves going to Majorca to meet billionaire playboy Javi Gutierrez and to be the guest of honor at his birthday.

Upon meeting Javi, Nick is initially annoyed by his neediness and insistence that they create an improvisational movie based on a script he wrote, but is soon inspired by Javi's determination, and the two of them quickly bond over their surprisingly shared love of films such as The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari and Paddington 2 (the latter of which Nick watches for the first time with Javi).
Soon after, Nick is confronted by CIA agents Vivian and Martin.

They suspect that Javi, who they claim made his fortune through arms dealing, is behind the kidnapping of Maria, the daughter of a Catalan anti-crime politician, with the hope that he will drop out of an upcoming election.
Nick insists that his acting instincts would've detected if Javi was a criminal, but he eventually decides to help the CIA with the mission.

After successfully rigging the cameras in Javi's compound, Nick attends a party where he announces his collaboration with Javi on a new movie, as an excuse to stay on the compound long enough to find Maria.
After a misadventure involving LSD, Nick and Javi decide that their movie should be about their relationship.
Nick later discovers that Javi keeps a shrine room dedicated to all of his movies, including a wax figure of his character Castor Troy from the film Face/Off, complete with identical golden pistols.
Vivian suggests that Nick includes a kidnapping in their script, to get Javi's reaction to it.
Nick explains his new idea to Javi, who believes that Nick is distracted by his family issues.
Vivian tells Nick to flee, or possibly kill Javi, as Javi has discovered their plot.
But Javi reveals he's brought Nick's family to his villa.
Nick tries to make amends with them, but they reject his appeal and accuse him of prioritizing his film career over his family.
Javi privately goes to meet with his cousin Lucas, who is revealed to be the true arms dealer and the one who kidnapped Maria.
Lucas warns him that Nick is working with the CIA and pressures him to kill Nick, or else Lucas will kill Javi.
Nick and Javi face off, but neither can bring himself to kill the other.
Lucas sends his men after both of them, and they race back to the house to discover that Addy has been kidnapped.

Nick takes Javi, Olivia and Javi's assistant Gabriela to the CIA safe house, only for the house to have been compromised; Martin has been killed, while Vivian sacrifices herself to kill Lucas's men before they can ambush the group.
With Javi's help, Nick and Olivia pose as a reclusive criminal couple to get close to Lucas.
He figures out their plan, but they still manage to escape with Addy and Maria.
Nick, Addy, Olivia and Maria race to the American embassy while Javi and Gabriela stay behind to delay Lucas's pursuit.
Upon arrival, Lucas holds Nick at gunpoint, but Addy tosses him a knife which Nick uses to kill him—transitioning into the movie that Nick and Javi completed, presumably based on their adventure.
Nick is applauded for his new film and congratulates Javi before going home with his family to watch Paddington 2, now with a better relationship.

title: Jordan Miller's Chronicles of Fearful Dreams
synopsis: The film begins with the scene of Jordan Miller, an extraordinary nine-year-old child, tossing and turning in bed, ensnared in an uproarious dream involving a bumbling tooth fairy with oversized wings that seem to function less effectively than a broken fan.
The absurdity of the dream resonates with an underlying essence of fear, causing Jordan to wake up in a chilly sweat.
The narrative takes us to an affluent neighborhood where Jordan resides in a tastefully furnished bungalow.
On the exterior, he is adored by individuals within his community, cherished by friends, but each night is a sequence of absurd yet terrifying dreams weaving an eerie tapestry in his young mind.

To help the child grapple with these overwhelmingly vivid dreams, Jordan's parents seek the expertise of Dr. Rose, a revered therapist renowned for her humanistic approach interlaced with an uncompromising staunchness.
Dr. Rose, through her empathetic counselling, proposes a unique idea to Jordan- maintaining a journal of his nightmares.
A striking black leather-bound book then becomes the deposit box for Jordan's self-stylized dream sequences.

An otherwise regular school routine takes an eerie twist when Jordan's dream-orchestrated alternate reality starts wiggling its way into routine activities like fetching milk from the cafeteria or completing assignments, layering them with portions of the ridiculous.
Amidst the chaos, Jordan's black leather journal documenting his so-called “Circus of Nightmares” finds its way into 'Book Haven', a bookstore frequented by locals, by an accidental misplacement.

Patrons of 'Book Haven' stumble upon Jordan's journal mistaking it for an eccentrically illustrated masterpiece, leading to an unexpected surge in its popularity and swiftly taking it on a merry ride to the bookstore’s bestseller list.
Max Wilde, a Hollywood director known for his penchant for the whimsical, finds himself intrigued by this bizarre bestseller.
Recognizing its potential, he envisions a comedy goldmine waiting to be unearthed by turning Jordan's nightly theatre into a script.
Max springs an unexpected proposition on Jordan, illuminating his plan to metamorphose Jordan's journal into a screenplay.
The prospect is initially met with resistance from Jordan but slowly, he begins to see its comedic potential.
Jordan finally agrees to Max's unusual project.
His apprehension is gradually replaced with anticipation, hoping to convert his fears into a comedy of errors.
Filming begins with Jordan's preposterously imaginative characters like extraterrestrial purple kangaroos and wing-embellished pigs morphing into reality, eliciting peals of laughter from the set.

The once-quiet film set, now transformed into Jordan's dream turned reality with singing frogs, tumbling tooth fairies, and clumsy aliens, becomes a breeding ground for staged confusion and unrehearsed hilarity.
Witnessing his fears transformed into a comedy act strengthens Jordan's resolve to face his underlying alarums head-on, helping him progressively heal with every burst of laughter on set.
The roller-coaster journey of filming the ridiculous finally concludes, leaving Jordan relieved, and, curiously, entertained.
A grand movie premiere is arranged at Hollywood's prestigious theatre.
It showcases the marvelous transformation of Jordan's grotesque nightmares into a comedic decree, leaving the audience doubled with laughter.
The Jordan that once feared nights, now stands in the spotlight as a sensational comedy figure, laughing at the absurdities of his fears and turning them into popular amusement.
At the rooster's call, he abruptly wakes up, chuckling at the newfound realization that his rise to stardom was all part of his ever-vibrant dreamscape.
Now brimming with humorous twists thanks to his dreams, Jordan awaits his next appointment with Dr. Rose, thrilled to share his transformed dreams with her.
In a reality-twisting sequence, Jordan wakes up once again and accepts that his entire journey from losing the journal to the grand movie premiere was a dream within a dream.
With his fears splayed open and laughed at, Jordan wakes up feeling invincible and liberated from latent fears, replaced by an infectious, unshakeable grin.
The film wraps up on a cheerful note with Jordan sharing his latest dream escapades with Dr. Rose.

title: Nobody (2021 film)
synopsis: Hutch Mansell sits inside of an interrogation room, heavily bruised and injured.
Two FBI agents interrogate him about his identity, before Hutch responds that he's simply "nobody."
In a flashback to a few days earlier, Hutch leads an ordinary, mundane life as an office worker with his emotionally estranged wife Becca, teenager Blake and a much younger daughter, Abby.
One night, two thieves break into his house with a gun.
Blake jumps one of the thieves and Hutch picks up a golf club but does not swing.
The thieves leave.
Everyone thinks Hutch a failure for not fighting, but Hutch reveals to his brother Harry that he held back because he knew the burglar's gun was unloaded.
Hutch's brother-in-law Charlie offers Hutch a gun for his own protection, which he refuses.
Hutch offers to buy out his father-in-law Eddie's business, but Eddie considers it a bad offer.
The following evening, Abby realizes her bracelet is missing and Hutch sets out to find it.
Hutch suspects the thieves from the previous night took the bracelet, based on one of their tattoos, which Hutch recognizes and uses to find the tattoo parlor they got it from.
Hutch locates the thieves and demands they return the bracelet, but leaves after realizing they do not have it, punching a wall in his frustration.
While on a bus heading home, a group of intoxicated thugs board the bus and begin harassing a young woman; Hutch brutally fights them off.

Unbeknownst to him, the group's leader, Teddy, is the brother of Yulian Kuznetsov, a Russian crime lord safeguarding the mob's Obshchak money (a common treasury used to settle disputes in the Russian mafia).
Hutch breaks Teddy's windpipe, before saving his life by piercing a straw through his neck, allowing him to breathe, but puts him in a comatose state.
Hutch returns home and is bandaged by Becca, who knows of Hutch's past.
He vents his frustrations about living a mundane life to her, before they reaffirm their love for one another.

Meanwhile, Yulian manages to identify and locate Hutch using his dropped metro card, and sends a team to Hutch's home to capture him while blackmailing a United States Department of Defense official to uncover Hutch's past.
Harry calls Hutch ahead and warns him of Teddy's connection to Yulian.
He asks Hutch to check with The Barber, Hutch's former government handler.
When the capture team arrives, Hutch hides his family and kills most of the attackers.
He is stunned by a electric taser, and captured by the Russian team.
While being transported, Hutch searches the trunk of the moving vehicle he's captured in,  and empties a canister of fire suppressant into the car.
The driver crashes, killing most of the occupants, and freeing Hutch.
Hutch returns home and reveals that he is a former "auditor", an assassin employed by the United States Intelligence Community.
While working as an auditor, Hutch spared a target who later reformed and lived happily with a new family.
Wanting a similar life, Hutch retired and settled down.
Hutch sends his family to safety and retrieves his hidden gold and cash; he also finds Abby's bracelet under his couch.
He burns his house down to dispose of the dead attackers in the basement and steals his neighbor's Dodge Challenger.
Two assassins attempt to kill Hutch's father David at his retirement home but David, a retired agent himself, cleverly manages to defeat them.
Hutch uses his gold to buy his father-in-law's metal fabrication factory and booby-traps the entire place.
He then goes to burn Yulian's Obshchak money.
Hutch visits Yulian and offers to end the fighting.
Yulian also wants out as he cannot re-finance the entire Obshchak.
Knowing of Yulian's plans to retire, Hutch suggests a retirement in one of the lesser-known Caribbean islands away from the Russian mafia, while Hutch gets his life back.
However, Yulian and his men pursue him to the factory and surround him nonetheless.
Suddenly, Harry and David arrive to assist Hutch, and the trio kill Yulian and the Russian mobsters.
The police arrive and the opening scene is shown, but he is suddenly released without charges following a mysterious phone call.
Three months later, Hutch and his family have returned to normal life and buying a new house, when Hutch receives a call suggesting that he may be expecting more trouble.

title: Dreamer's Canvas (film)
synopsis: Our scene starts at Normanville High, where our central character, Alex, comes into play.
He's an introverted teenager, communicating more effectively with his paintbrush than within his peer group, finding it hard to navigate the often confusing realm of teenage culture.
Alex possesses an imagination that runs wild and free, deep and wide as almost boundless as the ocean.
He has a knack for articulating his most profound thoughts and visions into exquisite pieces of art, thriving in a world painted with color and different art expressions that know no boundaries.

Unfortunately, his parents, Mark and Sarah, and his schoolmates, lack a keen eye for such artistic abilities, ultimately driving a wedge between him and his peers, making him feel increasingly isolated and unappreciated.
During a regular after-school art workshop, amid a crowd of other students, Alex's teacher Miss Leslie spots one of his paintings.
Miss Leslie proposes a golden opportunity for Alex: The Artistic Nova, a prestigious city-wide art competition.
Alex grapples with his self-doubt, but the persistent push from Miss Leslie, coupled with her support, convinces him to give it a shot.
Alex breaks the news to his parents about his decision to tread this new journey.
The news sparks an argument about the supremacy of academics over seemingly non-lucrative pastimes.
Sensing tension, Miss Leslie reaches out to Alex's parents.
She advocates for his extraordinary talent, attempting to bridge the gap between their traditional viewpoints and Alex's unconventional passion.
Navigating criticism from his parents, ridicule from his classmates, and constant encouragement from Miss Leslie, Alex carves out hours from his days and nights to perfect his art piece.
Alex's persistent work begins to change his classmates' perception towards the appreciation of his unique abilities.
His parents start seeing his art in a new light and it might possibly be a meaningful career prospect in their eyes.
The day of the competition arrives.
As Alex steps onto the stage, his heart is overwhelmed with anxiety.
The panel of judges takes notice of Alex's painting amidst the applause, praising his distinct creative flair while commending the profound depth of his imagination and execution.
Alex's name is announced as the winner, triggering a wave of shock that washes over the auditorium.
Mark and Sarah stand in the crowd, overwhelmed with joy and pride.
The wind changes direction in Normanville High and creative expression is now valued pursuit on equal footing with academics.
Mark and Sarah morph from being indifferent observers into the biggest cheerleaders of their son.
His classmates, who once ridiculed him, now perceive him through a different lens, drawing inspiration from his resilience and remarkable creativity.
Alex's journey becomes an inspiring tale that fuels courage into every observer.
It compels them to strive after their own unique expressions and passions.

title: Revelations: Night Out in the City
synopsis: Robert, the endearing host of a local news talk show aired on WGNX-TV, is a treasured member of Clearfield, a tranquil town nestled in Kansas.
The simplicity that defines Robert's life takes a sudden turn when his charismatic old college roommate, Daniel, pays him a surprise visit.
Daniel, a flourishing advertising executive, hails from the fast-paced world of New York City.
Daniel, now enveloped in the unyielding cadence of New York life, makes an enticing proposition to Robert.
Daniel assures him of substantial networking possibilities, as well as the chance to rub shoulders with influential media figures within the bustling city that never sleeps.

Stirred by a newfound sense of curiosity and piqued adventure, Robert, for the first time, ventures out of his serene life in Clearfield to embark on an extraordinary odyssey towards the dizzying skyline of New York.
Daniel orchestrates Robert's immersion into the city's life, introducing him to influential media personalities such as Lauren Laverne and Anderson Cooper.
He is taken to dazzling galas held in luxuriant locations like the Rainbow Room.
On a bustling Friday evening, they step into The Stonewall Inn, a vibrant gay bar situated in Greenwich Village.
Amid the pulsing rhythm of celebratory beats and the vibrancy of rainbow-flag adorned surroundings, Daniel chooses to reveal a part of his life that Robert was unaware of - his homosexuality.
This unforeseen announcement leaves Robert grappling with a whirlwind of emotions, filled with surprise, confusion, and the challenge of deconstructing preconceived notions about homosexuality.
Alone in his rented apartment located in the bustling heart of Midtown Manhattan, Robert contemplates this unexpected revelation.
Robert brings a positive change to his television show by inviting members of the LGBTQ+ community for discussions and interviews.
Robert discovers a multifaceted, diverse community.
Their resilience and vibrancy profoundly unsettle everything Robert had initially misunderstood about the community.
As New York's relentless bustle becomes his new norm, and his professional journey evolves into a pathway for social change, Robert finds himself wrestling his recently unearthed sexual identity.
The emotional tumult magnifies with the sudden realization of his deep-seated feelings towards Daniel.
A confusing warmth towards Daniel dominates Robert's heart, leaving him spiraling into a whirlpool of confusing emotions.
Looking for solace in this turbulent time, he turns to the LGBTQ+ individuals he had met during his show, candidly revealing his internal struggle.
The compassion and understanding he receives from these individuals grant him the acceptance he needed.
A heart-to-heart conversation with an elderly gay man who had weathered similar struggles inspires Robert to truly understand and accept his sexuality, and with that, his feelings for Daniel.
With newfound courage and determination, Robert decides to share his journey with his audience by introducing the topic of "Coming out" on his television talk show.
In an episode that defies societal conventions, Robert admits his love for Daniel and reveals his homosexuality to millions of viewers nationwide.
His revelation disrupts the societal norms, dividing his audience into two - those who commend Robert's bravery and those who raise eyebrows.
Yet, amidst the ensuing controversy, his admission stirs an undercurrent of change in the public psyche, sparking a nationwide dialogue on homosexuality and broader acceptance.
The narrative culminates with a stirring scene of Robert and Daniel, hand-in-hand, walking through the shimmering lights of Times Square.
The scene symbolizes not just their endearing love, but also Robert's complete acceptance of his identity in a society that's slowly but surely moving towards acceptance.

title: Evelyn the Ant: The Dawn of Spring
synopsis: The film begins with enchanting, whimsical narration that introduces us to a bustling ant colony and its intricate ecosystem, ensconced within the intertwining roots of a mighty oak tree.
Amidst the seemingly labyrinthine corridors, overcrowded with diligent, industrious ants, we find our protagonist - an energetic young worker ant named Evelyn.
Out of all her kin, Evelyn is unique due to her insatiable curiosity and a fondness for exploration.
One day, the first warm breeze of springtime delicately wafts through the twig lined tunnels of the colony.
As Evelyn stirs from her slumber, she senses the shift in the season, bringing new hope and renewed vitality.
Joyful and excited, she hastens through the winding corridors of her subterranean home, keen to share the news of spring's imminent arrival with the rest of the colony.
Sensing her eager rush, Joe - another worker ant who harbours a secret fondness for Evelyn, takes notice.
Undeterred by their apathy, Evelyn decides to prove her claim and gather evidence of the season change.
Courageously, she decides to embark on a daring, unprecedented journey to the earth's surface.

Concerned for her safety, as well as spurred by his camaraderie and affections, Joe decides to accompany the eager Evelyn through the complex maze of root-laden catacombs leading to the world beyond their sheltered existence.
As they journey through unexplored parts, they stumble upon ancient murals and inscriptions on pebble walls, depicting ant lore that plays a significant role in predicting the arrival of spring.
Excited, they perceive this as a positive omen reaffirming Evelyn's belief in the changing season.
Inadvertently, they overhear a malevolent mole scheming to infiltrate their home colony to store his sizable springtime cache.
The threat to their home strangles their joy of exploration, replacing it with a pang of fear and anxiety.
As comprehension dawns on the brave ants, Evelyn and Joe realise that they are the only ones who can save their home.
The urgency of the situation is exacerbated by the fact that their kin and their colony are blissfully ignorant of the impending danger looming just around the corner.
Galvanized by their newfound responsibility, their return journey becomes a frantic race against time.
These trials serve to solidify their resolve to rescue their family, only strengthening their determination.
She utilises every lesson from her journey, every tidbit from the ant lore, as she devises a shrewd strategy to deter the approaching mole.
Armed with unwavering determination and razor-sharp intellect, she prepares for the urgent battle ahead.
Amid escalating tension, the valiant ant confronts her fears head-on, promoting courage and wit over sheer power to thwart the unfolding challenges.
Defying all odds, Evelyn teams up with Joe to outwit the mole using clever tactics and fast thinking.
Their ingenious ploys successfully thwart the mole invasion, averting an imminent disaster that would have threatened their existence.
Accepting Evelyn's warnings, which they once dismissed cavalierly, the ant colony rejoices in the afterglow of their successful defence.
They are awestruck by Evelyn's dedication, her act of lone bravery that preserved their home, showering her with praises and lauding her as their protectress - a heroine in the truest sense.
Her solitary joy becomes a collective celebration vibrating through every corner of their underground abode.
Evelyn, once a lone voice advocating for the acceptance of change, becomes the colony's guiding beacon towards spring preparations.
Throughout the course of the narrative, Evelyn metamorphoses from a curious worker ant into the colony's courageous protector.

Her adventurous exploration, comprehending the cryptic ant lore, outsmarting malevolent threats, and selflessly preserving the colony, all add layers to her courageous persona, making her no less than a legendary heroine.
Her immense bravery resonates with viewers across age groups.
Her story provokes a sense of awe and admiration, leaving an indelible mark in their hearts.
The film subtly engrains core values into the minds of its viewers, immortalizing lessons that were once indifferently overlooked, within their consciousness.
As the narrative weaves into its thrilling denouement, it fills viewers with a sense of fulfilment.
Leaving them yearning for more such ventures, it keeps their excitement ignited even in its conclusion.

As the tale of Evelyn and her bustling ant kingdom concludes, the audience exits the theatre with a warmed heart and a lesson etched in their minds; offering a fitting end to an enlightening subterranean adventure.

title: Vigilant: The Dark Side of Recovery (2021 film)
synopsis: The protagonist, Jane Doe, is introduced.
Her portrayal is a seasoned one; a courageous retired Army healthcare professional.
However, the unyielding spectre of opioid addiction, a struggle from her past, continues to cast a sorrowful shade over her life.

After leaving the harsh battlegrounds for a more peaceful existence, Jane now walks the hallowed halls of Harvard University, garbed in the uniform of a safety officer, swapping her combat boots for measured footsteps and assault rifles for trusted keys.

With a profound twist of irony, Jane's prime responsibilities include ensuring the safety and wellbeing of Harvard's students and safeguarding its distinguished premises from any potential threats or dangers.
But beneath her stern demeanor and steady composure lurks a perilous secret.
Once everything has settled into a quiet stillness, Jane takes advantage of her position and stealthily breaks into Harvard's well-equipped labs, stealing the in-demand opioids.
It starts on one eventful night when Jane's clandestine operation is severely compromised.
A chemistry student, Ben, accidentally stumbles upon her illicit activities as he sneaks into the lab for some late-night research.
Jane, trapped under Ben's wide-eyed gaze, is forcefully reminded of the consequences that would follow if her secret ventures get exposed.
Her professional reputation would spiral down in an unstoppable nosedive, leaving her personal world in shambles.
In a desperate bid to salvage the situation, Jane sees no choice but to rope Ben into her secretive world.
With an awkward smile, she throws a mentoring offer on the table, promising Ben academic guidance in chemistry and personal support, hoping that he would agree to stay silent in return.
As their mentorship journey begins, Jane steps into the role of a surrogate mother for Ben, a socially awkward genius.
She understands his inhibitions and nurtures his academic growth while sharing the pearls of wisdom life has gifted her.
Time quickly passes, marked by the changing seasons and the steady transformation of Ben.
In the meanwhile, Jane finds herself forming an unexpected bond with Ben and grows to trust him with her secrets.
For Ben, Jane was not just an academic tutor.
She was also a personal moral compass who accepted him with his quirks and shortcomings, providing him companionship he greatly missed in his life.
As Ben becomes an integral part of her life, Jane starts questioning the choices she's been making.
She starts wondering if the thrill of her nocturnal adventures outweighs its grave moral repugnance.
But as their peculiar bond strengthens, their world is tossed into disarray when Jane learns about an imminent federal inspection of Harvard's pharmaceutical labs.
This sudden turn of events places her at a dangerous precipice, threatening to shatter the intricate bond she built with Ben, the only stable amid her chaotic existence.
After days of heart-wrenching turmoil, Jane finally decides to take the plunge.
She confesses to Ben about her opioid reliance during her days as an army nurse and her current clandestine pharmaceutical heists.
Even though the confession exerts an emotional toll on Jane, she bears it willingly, hopeful that Ben would understand her plight and unravel the rationale behind her daring actions.
Ben's initial reaction is shock which soon gives way to understanding.
His empathetic acceptance towards Jane's complex situation shows a maturity that defies his years.
Displaying unbelievable resolve, Ben chooses to stand by Jane in her difficult time.
He decides to assist Jane in disposing of the stolen medication before the inspection, reducing her burden appreciably.
Jane gratefully accepts his offer, moved by his unwavering loyalty and support, signifying a tight thread of trust that had become inseparable.
The duo embarks together on the precarious mission of disposing of large volumes of stolen opioids.
With every vial they dispose of, their stakes rise exponentially.
As the inspection day looms closer, the suspense nearly palpable in the air, Jane and Ben persist resiliently, growing stronger and more reliant on each other with every passing moment.
With the clock ticking ominously, the duo miraculously manages to dispose of all the stolen opioids.
They complete their task just in the nick of time, as the federal inspection team steps onto the serene Harvard campus.
Provoked by the intensity of the recent events, Jane finally acknowledges the need to turn a new leaf and reshapes the direction of her life.

She establishes a support group specifically designed for ex-military personnel, providing them a safe space to narrate their experiences, cope with their traumas, and assimilate into civilian life effortlessly.
Surprisingly, her initiative receives a warm response, acting as a beacon of hope to many retired soldiers who managed to find solace, thereby healing their troubled minds.
As the narrative unfolds, Ben, who was once a bystander in Jane's life, evolves into a prominent character, marking a remarkable progression in the storyline.
Inspired by Jane's transformation, Ben decides to channel his enthusiasm into providing mental support to others after his graduation.
Embracing his newfound role with grace and determination, Ben becomes a mental-health counselor at Harvard, where he guides others just like Jane guided him.
The film reaches its final act, where Jane and Ben are now seen leading a group therapy session in their support group — a far cry from their troubled pasts.

In an emotionally-charged scene, Jane, while addressing her audience about her journey, sends a look of heartfelt gratitude towards one individual — Ben, a chemistry student turned counselor who played an unintentional pivotal role in her life's transformation.

Jane, who was once lost in the complex web of opioid addiction and unlawful activities, is now seen walking confidently towards a promising future, with Ben by her side, ready to face whatever comes their way.

title: Orphan: First Kill
synopsis: In January 2007, Estonian psychiatric patient Leena Klammer, a 31-year-old woman with a rare hormonal disorder called hypopituitarism that gives her the appearance of a 9-year-old child, orchestrates an escape from the Saarne Institute by seducing and killing a guard and hiding in the car of an art therapist named Anna.

After breaking into Anna's house and killing her, Leena looks up missing American girls and finds that she bears a striking resemblance to Esther Albright, a girl from a rich family who went missing in 2003.
Later, posing as a lost girl, Leena is approached by a Russian police officer and introduces herself as "Esther", claiming that her parents are in the United States.

In Darien, Connecticut, wealthy artist Allen Albright and his wife Tricia, who has since come to terms with the disappearance of their daughter, are informed by Detective Donnan that "Esther" has been found.
Tricia travels to the U.S. embassy in Moscow where she is "reunited" with Esther.

Tricia brings Esther home and immediately starts to have doubts when she notices that Esther has forgotten about the death of her grandmother or that her painting skills have increased enormously compared to before she disappeared.
Leena falls in love with Allen after they both start bonding over their painting skills, and tries to separate him from Tricia.
While Tricia and Allen attend a charity gala hosted by Tricia, Donnan arrives at the house and steals a vinyl record from Esther's room which has Leena's fingerprints on it.
He takes it back to his house, unaware that Leena has followed him, and analyzes the fingerprints to find it is not a match.

title: Bingo Hell

Lupita then goes to see her hairdresser, Yolanda, whose electricity is being fixed by Morris.
Morris is not able to fix it because he says he doesn't have the right tools and leaves.

Caleb sets fire to the money and they escape, leaving Mr. Big to burn.

title: Lottery Haven
synopsis: John, a battle-weary veteran and the owner of a charming, rustic lottery shop nestled in the calm surroundings of Haven, a quaint town situated in the serene countryside of Montana, increasingly feels disillusioned and restless with the routine monotony that has become his life.
His restlessness intensifies, prompting him to seriously consider selling off his beloved shop.
Before he embarks on his intended journey, he chats with the town's elder, Agnes - a delightfully eccentric lady legendary for her uncanny predictive abilities.
With a stern look on her wrinkled face, she cautions him about a long-forgotten evil that may be tied to his wooden lottery machine.
John dismisses Agnes's eerie warnings with a nonchalant chuckle.
On his last evening in Haven, John's friends organize a heartfelt goodbye party at his childhood home, a log cabin filled with the fresh scent of pine.
Amidst the unforgettable celebration, the new owners of his shop, a vibrant young couple from the city brimming with ambition, pull John aside to share unsettling news.
They've noticed eerie, cryptic messages occasionally flashing across the screen of the vintage lottery terminals at the shop.
The town is shaken by the mysterious disappearance of the recent lottery winner, Bill Hayes.
John remains firm in his decision to leave.
As John sets off on a cloudy morning, the town is further gripped by panic as more lottery winners vanish under mysterious circumstances.
The local law enforcement urgently requests John to return to Haven, given his unique and exhaustive understanding of the lottery terminals.
John is plagued by a series of disturbing dreams and terrifying visions linking back to his old shop.
Wrestling with an uncanny sense of dread and apprehension, he grudgingly admits that he might have accidently stirred a sinister entity that is now wreaking havoc amongst his familiar townsfolk.
Overwhelmed with dread and guilt, he makes the difficult decision to return to Haven.
Back in Haven, he reunites with Sam, a childhood pal who is now a dependable local cop.
Together, they form a formidable team ready to unravel the ominous mysteries ensnaring their once peaceful town.
They discover a long-forgotten secret of Haven.
The town had once served as a sanctuary for banished supernatural beings.
They find out that the malevolent spirits haunting the recent lottery winners were once imprisoned in John's old lottery machine.
By selling the shop, the balance had been disrupted, freeing the spirits.
The innocent-looking lottery balls transform into blood-curdling spectral projectiles, attacking the brave group assembled in the shop.
The missing lottery winners start reappearing, horrifyingly transformed into nightmarish versions of their most profound fears.
The death toll starts to rise.
Martha, the town's beloved baker and motherly figure, falls prey to the supernatural onslaught.

Emboldened by his sense of responsibility and the town's dire state, John galvanizes everyone around him, instilling in them renewed hope and determination to reclaim their town from the spectral tormentors.
They come face to face with the primary evil spirit, which has assumed the human form of Bill Hayes.
Relying on his vast knowledge of his store's history and the folklore surrounding it, John comes up with a daring plan to re-imprison the spirits back within the lottery terminals.
As the confrontation pushes John and his team toward their limits, they bravely fight against these formidable entities in a gripping face-off.
Amidst the ensuing intense chaos, John barely manages to trap the spirits back into the machine, restoring a temporary sense of peace in the town.
Surviving the ordeal and unearthing the depths of his resilience, he reconsiders his decision to leave and chooses to stay back in Haven.
Life in Haven gradually returns to normal, and John finds charm in what he once found mundane about the town.
But as this tale of fear and courage comes to an end, a soft, unnatural hum and a glow from John's veteran lottery machine indicate that the peaceful times might be temporary.

title: Suburban Shadows
synopsis: As the movie unfolds, we see John, a self-assured computer engineer, and Mary, a perpetually vibrant schoolteacher and newlywed wife, relocating to a delightful Victorian-style house.
Nestled in the serenity of Massachusetts's suburban landscape, their newfound residence looks every bit the charming home they'd always dreamed of.
As the couple acclimatizes to their new home, their bright faces beam with a profound sense of joy.
They look forward to cultivating their vegetable patch in the verdant backyard and inviting friends over to their quirky abode for intimate dinner parties.
However, their joyous reality slowly begins to intertwine with an unfamiliar, ominous undercurrent.
Buried beneath the façade of the picturesque home lie potential challenges and mysteries that elude the couple's knowledge.
Their excitement begins to oscillate between anticipation and unease as they meet with the house's enigmatic architect, Robert Smith.
Distinguished by his white, bushy beard and a curt demeanour, Smith imparts an unsettling presence that permeates the serene household.

Smith's peculiar behavior, accentuated by his avoidance of direct eye contact and his cryptic responses to their questions about the house, unleashes the first waves of suspicion in the couple's mind, consequently shadowing their initial enthusiasm.
A particular day turned pivotal when Mary stumbles on a newspaper clipping, aged and frail.
The piece hinted at Robert Smith's potential involvement in occult practices and his connection with a secretive, notorious society, shrouding him in an aura of mystery.
This revelation strikes Mary like a lightning bolt, triggering a whirlpool of curiosity intertwined with escalating apprehension.
John, however, brushes these allegations off as nothing more than small-town chatter, a classic case of the public's proclivity towards exaggerated tales and sensationalism.
Then follows a phase where they endeavor to retain normalcy in their enigmatic home until an antiquated wooden chest springs up amid the attic's dust.
This chest conceals antique curios and pale yellow letters, their antiquity echoing corresponding tales unspoken.
The letters, festooned with grotesque and unreadable symbols, hold an eerie gravitas.
Meanwhile, the curious trinkets bear an uncanny resemblance to the tools often associated with occult rituals.
The harsh reality of their situation dawns on Mary, spiraling her into a state of fear-stricken anticipation.

Their once idyllic house now transmogrifies into a hotbed of uncanny phenomena - inexplicable creaking sounds echoing in the dead of night, household objects migrating on their own, and fleeting shadows dashing across rooms, fostering an environment of discomfort.
As Mary wrestles with her mounting fears, John, spurred by resolve, plunges headfirst into investigating Robert Smith's past architectural endeavors.
His in-depth scrutiny into Smith's previous constructions reveals an unsettling pattern of otherworldly occurrences and riddles associated with Smith's other works.

The hair-raising accounts of Smith's past creations—events chalked up to accidents, mysterious happenings, and abruptly abandoned houses—force John to confront and reassess his initial dismissive stance.
As the narrative progresses, John and Mary develop a close bond with their neighbors, a pair of elderly folks.
This friendship unravels hushed whispers and shared fearful glances, reflecting parallel bizarre experiences in their neighbor's home.

Despite the fear clearly etched on their faces, the neighbors remain tight-lipped about their experiences, living under the constant threat of societal judgement and the possibility of social exclusion.
Accepting the supernatural presence as a grim reality, John and Mary seek guidance from Father Andrew.
A respected local priest, Father Andrew is revered for the profound wisdom he's accumulated over the years.
Father Andrew, a man of unwavering faith and remarkable spirit, agrees to perform an exorcism.
Yet, he warns of a potentially hazardous backlash, a response from the spirits at being banished from the premises.
The prospect of an impending exorcism instills a mix of fear and hope in the couple.
Yet, their anticipation is short-lived.
Father Andrew vanishes without a hint, plunging their community into a pit of shock and uncertainty.
Father Andrew's abrupt and inexplicable disappearance causes ripples in the local community, painting an atmosphere swirling with shock, fear, and insidious suspicions.
Now pressed into a corner by their circumstances, with increasing panic gripping their hearts, John and Mary engage Amelia Brown's services.
A reputed psychic, Amelia is revered for her bravery and keen intuition.
Amelia, a striking woman in her late forties with soul-searching blue eyes, arrives, radiating an aura of calmness.
Her serene presence offers a momentary respite to the harrowed couple.
Amelia's revelations force the couple to confront the alarming reality of Smith's malevolence.
He had intentionally ensnared anguished spirits within the confines of his architectural marvels, intending to weaponize them.
Amelia paints a daunting picture before the couple.
To rid their home of these long-lingering spirits, they would need to muster their deepest courage and prepare for massive psychological onslaught.
Notwithstanding the rising terror gnawing at their hearts, John and Mary stand resolute.
They pledge to rid their home of the tormenting spirits, come what may.
Moved by the couple's resolve, Amelia devises a risky plan.
Her strategy involves beguiling the restless spirit into revealing its existence.
Guided by Amelia's instructions, John and Mary recreate occult rituals, hoping to dupe the spirit into considering them part of its fold.
The spirit, intrigued by the couple's faux occult practices, reveals its presence, proving Amelia's theory to be accurate.
Seizing the opening, John and Mary doggedly continue their charade, emboldening the spirit to confide further into Smith's esoteric rituals.
Angered by their audacity, the spirit (now known to be a wrathful female specter) discloses the convoluted ritual necessary to sever its mystical bond with the house.
Sensing their duplicity, the spirits' skepticism manifests as furious tempests tearing through the house, flooding the interiors with icy gales.
The house throbs with the spirit's wrath, culminating in Amelia being forcibly hurled away by an indiscernible force, leaving a flustered John and Mary on their own.
Facing limited options, John and Mary scramble to enact the complex exorcism ritual as revealed by the incensed spirit.
Their frenzied attempts to complete the ritual, amid the relentless onslaught from the unseen spirit, form the heart-stopping climax of the movie.
Even as fear flutters in their gaze and sweat trickles down their faces, John and Mary exhibit unyielding unity, holding their ground against their spectral adversary.
Their tenacity eventually wins.
The mysterious bond crumbles with a resounding wail from the spirit, signaling her abrupt departure, leaving behind an eerily quiet house.
In the aftermath, the deafening silence fills the couple with a comforting sensation of victory as the once foreboding ambiance dissipates, replaced by peaceful calmness.
Word of their valiant stand and consequent triumph cascades through the neighborhood, creating waves of gratitude, relief, and awe among the townsfolk.
With the shadow of fear now replaced by a ray of hope, normalcy slowly creeps back into their suburban community.
Residents now feel brave enough to bask in the daylight, their children revelling in outdoor games.
Amid the unfolding events, John and Mary emerge resilient.
Their shared trials and turbulence had forged their bond, and the appreciation from their community further validated their courage.
Their lasting love took on a heroic hue after they stood undeterred in the face of the lurking terror within their home.
Their unwavering devotion to each other became their guiding light.
The journey from a naïvely happy couple to bravely confronting supernatural adversities had led them to reclaim their tranquil home.
Having emerged from their harrowing experiences, they dedicated themselves to assist others similarly tormented by Smith's malicious architectural designs.
They offered support, sharing their experiences and the knowledge they'd gained during their ordeal.
Their strength had evolved, no longer anchored in blissful ignorance, but stemming from their newfound wisdom and courage.
The dream of a peaceful domestic life they initially sought nods at them from a closer distance.
It was now a reality, albeit hard-earned through their relentless struggle against what was lurking unseen.
John and Mary now dwell in peace, treasuring their beautifully quaint suburban home.
They are ever aware of their eerie past, and the triumph they had won in claiming the house truly theirs.
While the tormenting spirits were banished, the bravery within John and Mary had sparked, equipping them to face any future challenges with a newfound resilience.
The film concludes with this resonant message: True heroes are not born pre-formed, they are molded and shaped in the fierce furnace of trials and adversities.
This couple's transformation from ordinary to extraordinary proves this ideology beyond doubt.

Initially, they are happy, but soon they discover that the house has a dark history and is inhabited by malevolent spirits. As they delve deeper into the mystery, they learn about Smith's esoteric rituals and his intention to bind a spirit to the house. With the help of Amelia, an expert in the occult, John and Mary devise a plan to trick the spirit and eventually perform an exorcism ritual to free the house from the spirit's grasp.

### Summary of Each Segment and Character Development

- **Introduction**: The story begins with John and Mary moving into their new home, excited about their future together.

- **Rising Action**: As they learn more about Smith's rituals and the spirit, they become more determined to free their home from the malevolent presence. Amelia joins them, bringing her expertise to help devise a plan.
- **Climax**: The couple faces a terrifying confrontation with the spirit as they attempt to perform the exorcism ritual.
- **Falling Action**: They successfully complete the ritual, banishing the spirit and restoring peace to their home.
- **Resolution**: John and Mary emerge stronger, their love tested and proven. They decide to help others who might be suffering due to Smith's designs.

**Character Development**:
- **John and Mary**: Initially naive and happy, they evolve into brave and determined individuals. Their love becomes the foundation of their strength as they face supernatural challenges.
- **Amelia**: Introduced as an expert in the occult, she plays a crucial role in guiding John and Mary. Her character adds depth to the story, providing the necessary knowledge for the couple's plan.

### Detailed Chain-of-Thought Explanation for Each Ground Truth Turning Point

1. **Opportunity (tp1): 6.0** - Sentence 6: "But soon they discover that the house has a dark history and is inhabited by malevolent spirits."
   - This sentence marks an opportunity because it introduces a significant change in the couple's life, shifting their focus from building a happy home to dealing with supernatural threats.

2. **Change of Plans (tp2): 19.0** - Sentence 19: "The spirit, intrigued by the couple's faux occult practices, reveals its presence, proving Amelia's theory to be accurate."
   - This sentence represents a change of plans because it shows a shift from merely investigating the spirit to actively engaging with it through fake rituals.
   - **Reasoning**: Up until this point, John and Mary were primarily reacting to events. Here, they start taking proactive steps by mimicking occult practices, which is a significant deviation from their initial approach of simply trying to understand the situation.

3. **Point of No Return (tp3): 41.0** - Sentence 41: "Moved by the couple's resolve, Amelia devises a risky plan."
   - This marks a point of no return because once they embark on this plan, there's no going back; they are fully committed to confronting the spirit.

4. **Major Setback (tp4): 53.0** - Sentence 53: "Their frenzied attempts to complete the ritual, amid the relentless onslaught from the unseen spirit, form the heart-stopping climax of the movie."
   - This sentence represents a major setback because, despite their efforts, John and Mary face intense opposition from the spirit, which threatens to derail their plans.
   - **Reasoning**: The onset of the "relentless onslaught" indicates that the couple's actions have provoked a severe reaction. This escalation creates tension and uncertainty, marking a significant challenge to their resolve and capabilities.

5. **Climax (tp5): 60.0** - Sentence 60: "Word of their valiant stand and consequent triumph cascades through the neighborhood, creating waves of gratitude, relief, and awe among the townsfolk."

### Conclusion

- **Point of No Return (tp3)**: Sentence 41, when Amelia devises a risky plan to confront the spirit.
- **Major Setback (tp4)**: Sentence 53, where they face a relentless onslaught during the ritual.

These points highlight key moments in John and Mary's journey as they navigate the challenges of their haunted home, culminating in a triumphant victory over the malevolent spirit.

title: The Monster Hunter: Shadow of the Woodland Spirit
synopsis: Eldric, a revered monster slayer seasoned with thirty summers, stands at the edge of the grim and dark Dreadwood Forest.
His gaze pierces the slightest wind ruffles, attests to his readiness to hunt the elusive Voracious Viperwolf.
His eyes, fashioned to eagle-like precision from years of tireless training, are now latched onto the shadows behind the alien forest-trees.
He flickers between them, his agility akin to a panther, each stride more silent than the wind, affirming his mastery of coping with cryptic threats.
Prince Alfred rests in his affluent domain, Moonstone Nordhelm.
He indulges in a royal feast, gorging on culinary delights, gallivanting with jovial courtiers, blinded by the opulence at play.
His path intersects with that of Seriphia, a notorious Dryad spoken of in hushed whispers around the outskirts.
Drunk on his royal blood, Alfred recklessly bellows, ordering Seriphia to kneel before his noble lineage.
A gross display of arrogance, he becomes unknowingly responsible for triggering her wrath.
Seriphia's reply resonates in an echoing laughter, defying royal command.
This clash of status sparks a hostile clash, casting a heavy shroud of dread over the cheerful murals of Nordhelm.
Seriphia, in a cruel twist, turns to drain Alfred of his pride-induced energy.
A ruthless act that saps him into a pity-stricken state of physical and mental exhaustion.
On seeing the Dryad raise her arm to deliver a lethal blow, Eldric selflessly intervenes, launching his celestial Moonsteel blade against her.
An intense, whitening confrontation ensues.
Seeing a chance to salvage his honor, Alfred approaches Eldric with the olive branch of friendship and alliance.
Following this pact, Alfred endures a rigorous combat training regime under Eldric becoming adept in clashing steel, outwitting foes, and learns to coexist with Nordhelm's monstrous population.
Their combined forces successfully deter the minor beings lurking on the outskirts of Elderwood, inching closer every day towards Seriphia's wood-knotted abode.
They stumble upon an old, tarnished copper crown, stuck in the roots of a thousand-year-old Yggdrasil tree, an uncanny link to a forgotten Nordhelmian monarch.
Stoked by an overwhelming resolve to protect Nordhelm, the duo confronts Seriphia, triggering a final showdown that ripples the very essence of the kingdom.
Eldric's Moonsteel blade meets Seriphia's spectral energy, pushing each other to the brink of their combative abilities.
In an unprecedented move, Alfred swings a devastating blow against Seriphia.
Under Moonsteel's raw power, she splinters into sparks of dissolving ether.
But not before leaving Eldric with a grievous wound.
Eldric uses his waning breath to entrust the protection of Nordhelm to Alfred.
Alfred attempts to reconcile with Eldric's sacrificial death.
He pledges to shield Nordhelm from inevitable threats, honoring the memory of the brave hunter.
Alfred ushers an era of tranquility in Nordhelm.
A peaceful beginning signifying the dawn of a revitalized realm in his command.
A haunting howl slices through the serene night, spelling out the advent of a nerve-wracking chapter in the saga.
Standing atop the castle's highest tower, Alfred's shadowy presence forms a daunting silhouette against the moon.
A resounding royal decree reverberates across the dimly lit alleys of Nordhelm, rallying the kingdom folk to prepare for an impending assault.

Eldric sacrifices himself to defeat Seriphia, and with his last breath, entrusts the protection of Nordhelm to Alfred. The story concludes with Alfred pledging to shield Nordhelm from future threats and preparing the kingdom for an impending assault.

- **Seriphia**: Portrayed as a powerful, vengeful Dryad whose actions drive much of the plot's conflict. Her confrontation with Alfred and Eldric leads to her downfall.

### Chain-of-Thought Explanation for Each Turning Point

The opportunity turning point is defined as an introductory event that occurs after presenting the setting and background of the main characters, often setting the story in motion. #### Change of Plans (tp2): Sentence 14
The change of plans turning point is where the main goal of the story is defined, starting the main action. Sentence 14, "On seeing the Dryad raise her arm to deliver a lethal blow, Eldric selflessly intervenes, launching his celestial Moonsteel blade against her," marks this turning point. It's here that Eldric's intervention not only saves Alfred but also sets the stage for their alliance and the main conflict against Seriphia. This event shifts the focus from individual character introductions to a unified goal of defeating Seriphia, thereby changing the plans and direction of the story.

#### Point of No Return (tp3): Sentence 18
The point of no return is an event that pushes the main character(s) to fully commit to their goal. Sentence 18, "Their combined forces successfully deter the minor beings lurking on the outskirts of Elderwood, inching closer every day towards Seriphia's wood-knotted abode," signifies this turning point. By this point, Alfred and Eldric have formed a strong alliance and are making significant progress in their campaign against the threats to Nordhelm, including Seriphia. This sentence indicates that they are committed to their cause, having overcome initial challenges together, and are now moving towards a direct confrontation with Seriphia. There's no turning back from their mission to protect Nordhelm and defeat Seriphia.

#### Major Setback (tp4): Sentence 20
A major setback is an event where things fall apart temporarily or permanently. Sentence 20, "Stoked by an overwhelming resolve to protect Nordhelm, Alfred and Eldric eventually confront Seriphia in a final showdown," might seem like a moment of determination rather than a setback. However, considering the context provided by the ground truth, this sentence likely marks the beginning of a challenging confrontation that will result in significant loss, namely Eldric's sacrifice. The actual major setback is implied to occur during this confrontation, leading to a critical point in the story where the characters face their greatest challenge.

#### Climax (tp5): Sentence 25
The climax is the most intense or suspenseful moment in the story, often where the main conflict reaches its peak. Sentence 25, "Eldric sacrifices himself to defeat Seriphia, and with his last breath, entrusts the protection of Nordhelm to Alfred," represents this turning point. It's the culmination of the story's conflicts and character arcs, where Eldric's sacrifice saves Nordhelm but at a great personal cost. This event is the climax because it resolves the main conflict with Seriphia and sets the stage for the story's conclusion, focusing on Alfred's newfound responsibility and determination to protect his kingdom.

### Conclusion and Summary of Turning Points
In summary, the turning points in the story are:
- **Opportunity (tp1)**: Sentence 8 - Alfred orders Seriphia to kneel, initiating conflict.
- **Change of Plans (tp2)**: Sentence 14 - Eldric intervenes, saving Alfred and setting the stage for their alliance against Seriphia.
- **Point of No Return (tp3)**: Sentence 18 - Alfred and Eldric commit to their mission, making progress against threats to Nordhelm.
- **Major Setback (tp4)**: Sentence 20 - The confrontation with Seriphia begins, leading to significant loss.
- **Climax (tp5)**: Sentence 25 - Eldric sacrifices himself to defeat Seriphia, entrusting Nordhelm's protection to Alfred.

These turning points guide the narrative, shaping character developments and plot progression, and ultimately lead to the story's resolution.

title: The Prom (film)
synopsis: In Edgewater, Indiana, James Madison High School's head of the PTA, Mrs. Greene announces the school's prom will be canceled as the lesbian student Emma Nolan planned to attend with a girl.
Emma's girlfriend is Alyssa, Mrs. Greene's closeted daughter.
Principal Tom Hawkins supports Emma, but is powerless against the PTA's decision.
Meanwhile, in NYC, Broadway stars Dee Dee Allen and Barry Glickman are disappointed after their show Eleanor!
The Eleanor Roosevelt Story closes on opening night as the New York Times blasts their performances.

They are comforted by former sitcom star Trent Oliver, who now only plays forgettable supporting roles, and Angie Dickinson, who just quit the chorus line of Chicago after being passed over for the role of Roxie Hart.
Barry realizes they all need a cause to revitalize their careers.
Finding Emma's story on Twitter, the actors drive to Indiana with the non-Equity touring cast of Godspell and publicist Sheldon Saperstein.
At school, Emma is bullied and harassed by students Kaylee, Shelby, Nick and Kevin, who blame her for ruining prom.
The actors barge into the next PTA meeting and attempt to rally support for Emma.
Hawkins, a big fan of Dee Dee's, unsuccessfully tries to get her to back off.
The actors book a gig as the entertainment for a monster truck rally, but are booed off the stage for preaching about acceptance.
Hawkins tells them the Indiana Supreme Court has ruled that James Madison must allow Emma to attend prom.
That evening, he and Dee Dee bond over dinner.
The next day, is promposal day.
Barry visits Emma at her grandmother Bea's.
She has been living here since her sixteenth birthday when her parents threw her out for being gay.
Barry tells Emma that he ran away from home at 16 because he knew his parents wouldn't accept his sexual orientation and has not spoken to them since.

It is later revealed that the PTA has exploited a loophole in the Court's ruling by arranging for her to attend a separate prom alone while the rest of the students go to the real one at a private club.
Emma calls Alyssa for support, however she is too scared of losing her mother to come out.
Hawkins is disgusted when he learns the real reason that Dee Dee came to Indiana was to use Emma to prop up her career.
The next day, Mrs. Greene holds a press conference about the two proms.
Angie comforts a heartbroken Emma, while Barry persuades Dee Dee to get Emma on her ex-husband Eddie Sharp's talk show; in response, she insists that he call his mother Vera and make peace with her.
Dee Dee apologizes to Hawkins for lying to him and they reconcile.
Emma, upset that Alyssa won't stand up to her mother, breaks up with her.
Trent confronts Emma's tormentors, persuading them to support her with help from the Godspell cast.
Dee Dee arrives at the motel and tells everyone she traded Eddie her house in The Hamptons for Emma's slot on his show.
However, Emma turns the offer down to tell her story her own way.
She sings a song she wrote during a livestream, which goes viral.
The actors pool their finances to throw an all-inclusive prom for Emma.
Afterward, Dee Dee tells Barry she called Vera, who wants to talk to him.
Vera apologizes to Barry for her past treatment of him, so they make peace.
Kaylee, Shelby, Nick and Kevin apologize to Alyssa and Emma for their behavior.
Mrs. Greene tries to stop their preparations for the prom.
When Alyssa reveals who she really is, her mother leaves.
Alyssa and Emma reconcile.
Later that night, Emma and Alyssa arrive early to meet with the actors, Sheldon, Bea, and Vera.
Angie learns that she has been cast as Roxie Hart as Tina Louise has contracted shingles, Trent retires from acting to become James Madison's new drama teacher, and Barry is crowned prom queen.
The students and many teens from the local LGBT community show up to the prom in support of Emma.
As the event begins, Mrs. Greene arrives, apologizes, and embraces Alyssa, accepting her for who she is.
Dee Dee and Principal Hawkins share a kiss and start a relationship.
Emma and Alyssa share their first public kiss and everyone celebrates.
